word_mean: (缩db)分贝：用来表示电力或听力相对强度的单位，等于十分之一贝尔。测定的强度与某种参考强度的比率的常用对数乘以10即得分贝值，一分贝的变化为强度增加1.26倍，这大约是人耳所能觉察的最小声音变化。十分贝(一贝尔)的变化为强度乘10，约两倍于可以察觉的声音强度。听力测验法的参考强度(odb)相当于声压强度2×10－4dyn／cm2的均方根，约等于健康青年人的听阈。符号为dB

sentence.Network_en: The most usual system is that of the decibel scale.
sentence.Network_cn: 最常用的系统为分贝标度系统.

sentence.Network_en: A measure of sound intensity equivalent to one decibel at 1000 Hz.
sentence.Network_cn: 一种声强的量度单位,其值等价于1000Hz1分贝.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 20th cent.: from deci- 'ten' + bel (the unit being one tenth of a bel)

entry.tran: 分贝（表示声音强度的单位)
entry.def: A decibel is a unit of measurement which is used to indicate how loud a sound is.

example.ex: Continuous exposure to sound above 80 decibels could be harmful.
example.tran: 持续暴露在强度高于80分贝的噪声中可能有害。

means.word_mean: 1. a logarithmic unit of sound intensity; 10 times the logarithm of the ratio of the sound intensity to some reference intensity
